Member Function Documentation

virtual void ProgressHandler::progressBegin ( int  verbosity,
const std::string &  msg,
int  total 
) [pure virtual]

Begin a progress reporting.

After this initial call the progressStep call will be called N times where N = the parameter total passed in below.

Parameters:
verbosity - What level of verbosity is the progress associated with. Higher levels of verbosity produce more messages.
msg - String message associated with the beginning of this task.
total - Expected number of times that the progressStep() will be called after this.

Implemented in LogStream, MsgSocketHandler, and ProgressDot.

virtual void ProgressHandler::progressEnd ( int  verbosity,
const std::string &  msg 
) [pure virtual]

Signals the end of progress report.

Parameters:
verbosity - Level of verbosity associated with this progress report.
msg - Closing message from calling function.

Implemented in LogStream, MsgSocketHandler, and ProgressDot.

virtual void ProgressHandler::progressStep ( int  verbosity  )  [pure virtual]

This function is called when one unit of work has been done.

In general it is expected that the units of work should be roughly equal in size.

Parameters:
verbosity - At what verbosity level should this step be displayed.

Implemented in LogStream, MsgSocketHandler, and ProgressDot.

virtual void ProgressHandler::setBaseVerbosity ( int  level  )  [inline, virtual]

What level of verbosity is requested.

This is a hint to the class and can be ignored if desired.

Parameters:
level - Level below which progress messages are printed.

Reimplemented in LogStream, and MsgSocketHandler.
